description.value:
A creature moves within 30 feet of the hovercar

Effect The hovercar drives 30 feet in a straight line, dealing @Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures in the area it passes through (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save). Creatures damaged by the car are additionally knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Prone]. The trap then rolls initiative.

details.description: A hovercar's autopilot goes haywire, causing it to run over nearby creatures.
details.disable: @Check[computers|dc:26] (expert) to remotely reprogram the autopilot, or @Check[piloting|dc:24] or @Check[thievery|dc:24] (expert) to override the autopilot while aboard the car; three total successes are required to disable the trap; @Check[acrobatics|dc:23] or @Check[athletics|dc:23] to board the car (boarding doesn't disable the trap)
details.routine: (3 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each successful disable. The hovercar uses 1 action to drive 30 feet in a straight line, three times, changing direction between actions as desired. Creatures in the area the hovercar passes through take @Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save). Creatures damaged by the car are additionally knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Prone].
